summary: Bougainvillea is a genus of thorny vines and bushes, native to South America. It's known for its vibrant, colorful bracts that surround small white flowers. These bracts come in various stages and make the plant popular for decorative purposes. The genus has 4 to 22 species and belongs to the Nyctaginaceae family. It's named after explorer Louis Antoine de Bougainville.
title: Bougainvillea
